content:
About I am a Ph.D. candidate in Computer Science at NYU AI4CE Lab, advised by Prof. Chen Feng. Before that, I obtained my B.Sc. in Mathematics from New York University and NYU Shanghai.
My research aims to build embodied AI systems with human-like spatial intelligence, enabling it to operate safely and effectively in complex, real-world environments. Key topics include: Dual-System architectures that unify fast reaction with deliberate planning, using MLLMs for Spatial Reasoning, and creating interactive Digital Twins for robust simulation and training.

ðŸ“£ I'm always happy to collaborate with self-motivated UG/MS student on my exciting research projects. If you are interested, please directly send me an email with your resume and interest.
summary: About I am a Ph.D. candidate in Computer Science at NYU AI4CE Lab, advised by Prof. Chen Feng. Before that, I obtained my B.Sc. in Mathematics from New York University and NYU Shanghai.
title: Xinhao Liu
CityWalker: Learning Embodied Urban Navigation from Web-Scale Videos
Occ4cast: LiDAR-based 4D Occupancy Completion and Forecasting
SSCBench: Monocular 3D Semantic Scene Completion Benchmark in Street Views
DeepMapping2: Self-Supervised Large-Scale LiDAR Map Optimization
Self-supervised visual place recognition by mining temporal and feature neighborhoods
